snippet: Figurines used to promote the “China Dream” of President Xi Jinping have become a point of contention as some relatives of the original sculptor, recalling mistreatment by the Communist Party, seek to keep politics out of their business.
abstract: Campaign associated with Chinese president Xi Jinping aims to align Communist Party and traditional Chinese values by employing familiar statue of cherubic peasant girl; family of figurines' creators resent use of cherished folk art to advance political system that previously persecuted its creators and appropriated their name.

byline.contributor: Adam Wu contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Figurines used to promote the “China Dream” of President Xi Jinping have become a point of contention as some relatives of the original sculptor, recalling mistreatment by the Communist Party, seek to keep politics out of their business.

headline.main: A Chinese Folk Artist’s Descendants Are Split by the Government’s Use of Their Family Legacy
headline.print_headline: An Artistic Legacy in the Grip of China’s Leaders
